repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Sector Management Capacity
            Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Chad Petroleum Sector
            Management Capacity Building Project were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) need
            for a proper policy environment and a strong commitment by
            the highest authorities; 2) building realistic expectations
            as to the results that can be achieved with this type of
            projects, and the time frame for achieving them is a key
            element for securing the continued support of the
            stakeholders; 3) flexibility should be sought in the
            implementation of training programs designed to respond to
            immediate needs, and to develop a wider knowledge base for
            the creation of the human capital needed to develop the
            sector; and 4) continuity of the team working on the project
            is very important both for the Bank and the Borrower.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Management Response to Investigation Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management Response to the
            Inspection Panel Investigation Report responds to alleged
            claims that the Bank violated policies and procedures in
            regard to the Chad Petroleum and Development and Pipeline
            Project.  Management considered the findings of the Panel
            fully and developed concrete actions to address outstanding
            issues in regards to environmental assessment, economic
            analysis, poverty reduction, and the monitoring and
            supervision of projects. Management believes that the Bank
            has made exceptional efforts to apply its policies and
            procedures and to pursue concretely its mission statement in
            the context of the Chad Petroleum and Development and
            Pipeline Project. Given these actions, Management does not
            feel that, as a result, the Requestors' rights have
            been or will be directly or adversely affected by these
            Projects. Management remains committed to a process of
            regular consultation and disclosure to assure the
            environmental and social soundness of the Projects during implementation.

abstracts.cdata!:

            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates
            claims made by the Requesters in the Request for Inspection.

            policies and procedures. The Investigation Report examined
            the relevant directives and policies that covered five
            different topics: environmental and social safeguards,
            economics, supervision, and information disclosure. The
            Panel examined not only for compliance with the Bank's
            policies and procedures, but also whether harm was done as a
            result of Management action or omission.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Eligibility Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eligibility Report for the Chad
            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates the
            claims of the Requesters regarding the Request that people
            in the area of the pipeline project have suffered
            environmentally as a result of the project and failures and
            omissions in the design, appraisal and supervision by the
            Bank. The Investigation Panel conducted an investigation
            into the claims at the relevant Project areas. After
            evaluating the situation and the Requesters, it was
            determined that the Requesters are eligible according to
            Bank specifications. The Eligibility Report advises that an
            Investigation in to the matters alleged take place.

            Capacity-Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Petroleum Sector Management Capacity
            Building Project in Chad, will strengthen the petroleum
            resources' management capacity, within environmental,
            and social sound practices, and establish a framework for
            private sector investments in the petroleum sector. The
            components will: 1) strengthen the Government's
            capacity to manage, and mitigate the impact of the Doba
            Petroleum Project, - implemented in parallel to the
            petroleum project in Cameroon - by building the technical
            capacity to enable legal, financial, and environmental
            aspects to support project coordination. Training to
            government staff will be provided, in coordination with that
            for Cameroon counterparts; likewise, an International
            Advisory Panel will provide expertise on biophysical
            impacts, preventive health management, and socioeconomic
            aspects of petroleum projects. Technical assistance (TA),
            and logistic support will focus on the engineering
            monitoring, and evaluation of the Doba oil field area, and
            along the pipeline, and, include sponsoring for private
            investments. Infrastructure improvement will include water
            supply, and sanitation works, and the expansion of health
            services; 2) build the Government's capacity to manage
            the development of the petroleum sector, providing legal TA,
            and training on the implementation of the National
            Environmental Framework, and on data management on
            geological information.
